Posts.Title: Going for ultrasound today, freaking out CalieK juliaanna

Posts.Content: CalieK wrote: Hi.  I'm 44, had my regular mammogram monday, they called me back Tuesday for more diagnostic pics, now there's a "mass" they couldn't rule out with the 2nd mammogram so I'm going for an ultrasound this afternoon.  No lumps, but something is showing up.  I have an aunt and 2 cousins who dies from BC, and I'm pretty scared.  My biggest fear is leaving my 2 children- my daughter is 11 and her 2 best friends have each lost a parent to cancer- I never want my kids to go through that. I know it's early and I'm jumping to conclusions, but to be called back first for a second mammogram, now the ultrasound, is daunting and I keep crying.  I have supportive friends and boyfriend, but still pretty scared.  The radiologist didn't seem optimistic when she told me I needed the ultrasound, which also adds to my overactive imagination.  Just posting to let things out a little I guess....
